title: Outstanding care
body:
Called for appointment which was done easy by lovely receptionist 
Got my call back from my regular GP I had lots to discuss due to my mental health I felt listened to with respect compassion kindness and not rushed .
Without the support I got from the GP I wouldn’t have got through my day the best I could.I was giving so much advise kindness and compassion.my GP helped me feel valued as a person when I felt helpless he’s aware how difficult things has became for me on top of my mental health he gave me courage to do my best to keep trying one step at a time .i don’t believe he fully understands his impact of my GP dose for my health anxiety and GAD and depression  he’s a top doctor whom I trust 100% this is something I find difficult.he goes well above and beyond what I’d expect from a GP so a huge thank you

title: Very efficient
body:
I attended for my covid booster, all staff very friendly and efficient. 
I have had to contact the surgery through the pandemic have always been able get a telephone appointment and GP has always phoned back within the time specified.

title: Great care
body: I was injured in a cycle accident. The ambulance crew L102 couldn’t have been more helpful. They took care of the immediate injury and made sure I got home ok. Thank you!

title: Friendly family practice.
body: I had my flu jab today run by the practice at Corfe Hills.  Once again it was organised brilliantly.  Just as smooth as the Covid jabs at the Hamworthy Club.

title: Excellent service
body: Throughout the last 18 months the service offered by the practice has been first class in my opinion. The staff are extremely helpful and understanding. They offer a same day telephone call service with a doctor if the symptoms are not deemed to be an emergency and if necessary a face to face consultation thereafter. I'd highly recommend this practice.

title: Responsive and supportive
body: Friendly and helpful reception staff who were able to guide me when to ring back for an appointment same day, Helpful call back from the doctor who offered a face to face appointment to get more information and see the problem. Covid has put so much pressure on GPs and surgery staff but this was an excellent service Thankyou

title: Excellent practice
body: I needed to see a GP recently so I used the eConsult service. I had a phone consultation and face to face appointment really quickly. Everything was very efficient and professional. Staff at the surgery are extremely nice and put me at ease. It was a very positive experience and I received the help I needed quickly. Highly recommended.

title: Excellent efficiency
body: Superb efficiency at Corfe Hills School flu clinic on Saturday 4th December 2021. A very impressive service.

title: Fast flu jab
body: I attended the local flu jab clinic organised by the practice. It was a super slick process. In and out in no time. Lots of friendly folk guiding you through the process.

title: Amazing service
body: Went expecting a long wait. Pleasant staff, great care and very quickly sorted. In and out in just over half an hour, scald dressed and antibiotics prescribed.  Fantastic. Thank you so much.

title: covid vaccination
body: Brought my son for his 2nd covid jab yesterday, not been to the hospital before but the vaccination centre was well-signed and the whole experience could not have been better managed from start to finish. Thank you: it really is appreciated!

title: COVID Booster
body: Excellent set-up, 20 minutes from parking to getting back to the car longest part was the 15 minute after jab wait to check for any issues or reactions. Has been an excellent service throughout

title: Exceptional care
body: I was admitted on 23/11/2021 as a daycase but had to stay overnight. The Surgeon, Anaesthetist Theatre staff and nursing staff were exceptional, they were professional and extremely caring. I would recommend this hospital to anyone 5* plus

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fabulous place
body: Had my op on 4/12/21 I was very nervous walked through the doors and my nerves disappeared staff are lovely very friendly and helpful surgeon and his staff were wonderful  I can not only see again but I have been given my life back and for that I am truly grateful thank u so much to everyone involved

title: So professional yet full of empathy
body: I had to contact this surgery on my daughters behalf when she was too poorly to do so. I just want to thank them for the time they took to listen understand and provide everything they could to help us both. The lady who answered the phone was the kindest most helpful receptionist I have ever encountered, who went above and beyond to get my daughter help. The doctors who look after my daughters were able to act quickly and really help. My daughter is an adult who lives away from my home, but I am reassured she is receiving the best possible care from this practice. Thank you to all who work there for your hard work and compassion.

title: Brilliant Practice.
body: I've been at this surgery for going on 20 years. Yes, getting an appointment is a pain some days, sorting out prescriptions takes time and maybe a  couple of phone calls but I feel compelled to counteract the negativity I'm reading  as, for me as a patient  they have been fantastic.  They have got me through cancer and I live with several ailments now, I'm checked on and monitored regularly. When I listen to friends complain about their GP Surgery, I feel blessed to be with this one. For me, they are 5 stars.

title: Thanks
body:
Visited A&E yesterday the 4th December with what I thought was a broken foot. Which luckily it wasn’t. 
Triage, X-ray and results in just over 1 hr 45 mins - reception staff not over friendly - but A&E was very busy. 
All the other staff I encountered where great. 
Plus the parking system they have is amazing . £3.50 for that time - bargain in comparison to other local hospitals. 
Thanks West Mid !!

title: Friendly service
body: Great for advanced bookings, to be avoided in case of short notice emergencies. I had a great experience when spoke in advance for the flu jab and the covid booster but absolutely let down when needed to call and get some info. The practice is great, the phone service not...

title: Stress Free Experience
body: I attended the hospital on Friday 3rd December 2021 and found the staff from the front door and reception in the Outpatients and in the Maxillo Facial Surgery warm and friendly.  I was put at ease immediately and I felt I was in the company of friends.   Everything was explained clearly so I knew what to expect during the procedure.   Thank you one and all.

title: Repeat prescription problems
body: I’ve gone online to order two repeat prescriptions and I can’t order them because I need two separate reviews. I’ve had no prior notification of this so it now means I cannot get my medication in time. I don’t understand why they don’t give you notice that you need a review.

title: A business. Not a well-being clinic.
body: Having sought help for a young family member with a GP referral for private counselling I was very disappointed with the response from Priory Clinic Canterbury. Several chasing phone calls back and forth, messages going missing between calls etc. was told by a manager that demand for private counselling was very high and that they could effectively cherry pick who they wanted to take on their books. When I asked why they only took on the easier cases, they referred me to Camhs, despite acknowledging that there’s currently a 2 year waiting list and therefore this would not work for us. I was told that the doctors are self employed within their business model and could therefore take on who they wanted to help. This I guess is the essence of private care. The staff I spoke with were all helpful and professional. However I did feel that they simply couldn’t be bothered to help us, despite being in a really tough situation. It’s a business, not a caring, life saving service. Now looking elsewhere for urgent help.

title: Great practice
body:
Good service lovely staff very helpful
when I phone with any problems my GP is very helpful and has help me get through lock down with advice and seen me face to face when nesersary. All the nurses and staff have been working so hard to help everyone through the lock down I would like to thank them all.

title: Longleat ward
body:
Visited my 88 year old mother tonight . 
I’m yet to assess the quality of the nursing care but a health care assistant was so rude and unprofessional tonight that I am certainly feeling concerned about the care . I do hope this wasn’t a ‘normal’ approach with the rest of the multi disciplinary team . I Left the ward and burst into tears . Will obviously be discussing further with sister/matron on Monday . 
Absolutely understand that all NHS providers are stretched at the moment ( what with being a specialist nurse myself) - but really so disturbed by this HCA’s attitude .

title: Never got a call back
body:
Called at 11:20 this morning due to my two year old having a high temp and fast spreading rash and was inconsolable. Clinician called back an hour later and said the out of hours doctors close to me would call me to come in so they could check him over. At 4pm I called the out of hours myself after 43 attempts. I was then shouted at by a rude man who asked where I got their number from as it was for medical professionals only. I’ve never spoken to someone as rude as him. I explain that the voicemail on their practice gives the number out to which he said well I better make sure they take it off them. He asked for my sons name and said il let the doctors know. It is now 22:30. No call and 111 are basically engaged. My son is still poorly but finally managed to go to sleep. I’ll be sleeping in his room tonight. 

I fully understand the nhs is under immense pressure and I really do believe they should be treated better and paid better. But to be spoken to so rudely and then never get a call back is unacceptable and I will be pushing a complaint further.

title: Poor quality, unprofessional service
body:
Paediatric A&E usually takes 6-8 hrs in the waiting room before being seen
 This is how long I always had to wait with either of my children in the last 6 years on 5-6 occasions.

Yesterday's trip with a 3yr old took a 9 hrs turn around. Staff are slow, unprofessional and unhelpful.

One nurse literally laughed when my 3 yr old son screamed in pain. Nurses blatantly lied about how "swamped" they were, yes waiting area was full but behind the glass nurses were literally chilling, chatting, hanging out with each other while sick kids and frustrated parents were left in a cramped and very dirty waiting room.

Assessment area was literally empty once my child an I were shown in so "busy" seemed bs unless they had 1 doctor on call. Which clearly they didn't.

Lab took hours.

Lab results were never provided, just some pathetic release paper that contained no useful information.

Given my child had severe bloody diarrhea at a young age and we were sent by a GP to be seen immediately, this last experience made my blood boil. 

Literally people working at At George's a&e do not care, how long can this unit treat patients like they are attending a meat market not a hospital. This has nothing to do with COVID, service was always of extremely poor quality.

title: communication with carers
body:
My Mum was admitted to A+E with severe back pain and concern about the safety of her mobility.  I would like to start with saying how grateful I am for the care, kindness and consideration given to my Mum  from the Paramedics and A + E staff.
I settled her in and fed back medical history to nurse and left with the agreement Doctor would call me when she had been assessed.  She did and I fed back medical history (at no point did I say she lived in a care home with 24hr staff support). The Doctor said Mum would be assessed by mobility team and the possibility of them assessing Mum at home if necessary.  She said it was unlikely Mum would be discharged that night however,  no decision has yet been made.  I then missed a call at 1.47am from a private number with no voicemail for me to return call.  The next call was at 4.15am from the Paramedics who were at Mums home and needed the code to enter building (they were under the impression Mum lived in a care home with 24hr staff support -( it is sheltered with no out of hours staff, the staff are there 9-4 Monday - Friday and do not provide any form of care )  I went straight over to help settle Mum in and discovered her medication had not been sent back with her.  I called the ward who said they had it and I arranged to  pick it up later that day only to be told they had lost it when i got there, leaving her with no medication for that night.  I had to arrange an emergency prescription from GP and luckily for Mum the chemist had all her Medication in stock.  This was not a stressful day starting at 4.15am for me it was very Distressing as I am Mums sole carer and am doing my best to care for her and keep her safe.  
The  lack of consideration and communication (I had explained I am Mums sole carer) to me left me feeling unsupported and completely alone in caring for Mum.

title: Shambolic COVID Vaccine Service
body:
Booked an appointment to have the booster COVID vaccine few weeks ago. When I went to the centre there was a very long que and I was I told to que like everyone else even though I had booked an appointments. The reason for the long ques were lack of clinical staff on site, and  treating people who who were walking in without appointment and those who had booked an appointment in advance, in the same way. If you don't have enough staff, you have to prioritise those who have made an appointment first and not create chaos in the centre. Overall the volunteers and staff in the centre were unprofessional and rude. 
I work for NHS in a large hospital, and currently there is no excuse to drop clinical standards and find reasons like COVID pressures to justify your poor quality service. Completely shambolic service.

title: Great practice
body: All the staff I’ve come across at the surgery have been lovely. I called up late afternoon as my little one was poorly, and within an hour, I had spoken to a doctor on the phone and then seen shortly after for a face to face appointment. I know what it’s like working in a GP surgery to I understand how much pressure the staff are under and they’ve always been so helpful. Just want to say thank you to all the receptionists/admins, doctors and nurses.

title: Great experience despite staff shortages
body: This was my second time giving birth at St Thomas'. The amazing staff made everything from antenatal care to delivery and postnatal care a positive experience. Waiting times could be rather long, due to the midwives teams being extremely short-staffed but everyone from receptionists to midwives and doctors kept making sure all mums are ok and constantly apologised for keeping us waiting (although it was not their fault). I was able to give birth in the Home from Home area, which was an incredible experience. I felt looked after, informed and on good hands at all times. I would highly recommend the maternity services of St. Thomas' Hospital to everyone, and would gladly return. I just hope the midwives get the recognition they deserve, in these trying times they are true heroes.

title: Empathy of staff
body: I had a routine visit for diabetes review during which nurse suggested I see a doctor for another issue which she had picked up through careful questioning  An appt was made very quickly,  and this, again,  have a good diagnosis done with care plus an appointment with another part of practice  At all times,  I felt I was being listened to sensitively,  and that something I had been worrying about for some time but not mentioned was dealt with

title: Great service
body:
In this difficult climate GP^s are under increasing pressure and getting slated.
This is why I feel the need to write something positive
My step daughter is suffering with headaches and pain from.an accident.
She was previously registered with another surgery 
From the receptionist who helped her to register to the GP that spoke to her..The service she received was second to none. They were patient kind and caring. As well as pitching it at her level been 17. 
Just cannot fault them enough

title: Great care but phone calls need to change!
body: My dad is very poorly in the stroke unit. As we cannot see him due to covid, his life is in their hands but sadly the compassion when we ring is zilch! Sorry but this needs to change!! You are with these poorly people everyday , we can’t visit so think how we are feeling back at home!!

title: Wonderful care
body: We were referred in to A&E as my mother had severe abdominal pain and a mass diagnosed by the GP a week earlier. She was in pain, made worse by her Alzheimers.   She was seen immediately and transferred to the Surgical Assessment Centre. Within 4 hours we had a full diagnosis and a plan of care. She was then transferred to Ward 19. The staff were exceptional throughout, kind and clear.She stayed on the ward for a week and was discharged home for palliative care. Every member of staff were amazing.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Practice
body:
We came and received out covid boosters on 4th December after we received a invite  by letter..  everyone was so polite, happy and very helpful..  everything was spotless and the whole procedure was done with minimum of fuss despite an extremely full car park.
Very impressed.      Thank you

title: Satisfied patients
body: My husband & I have both had reason to see our GP in recent months. We have been perfectly happy with the care & service we have received from the practice. We completely understand how difficult life is for General Practice at the moment & wish more people felt the same way.

title: Excellent service
body: Helpful & friendly staff, can always get an answer on the phone & have received excellent care from them

author: dancefq73
title: Visit to medical centre
body:
[Very unhappy with 'Lekarz']  
  
[Very unhappy with 'Leczenie']

title: Fine practice, extremely rude receptionist
body: The practice itself is fine, pretty standard GP experience. The issue is getting past the incredibly rude receptionist, who will interrupt you with the most unprofessional tone and is incredibly unhelpful.

author: robinng93
title: No one answers the phones.
body: Called on Monday for an appointment to speak to a doctor. On hold for over 2 hours, only moved from position 30 to 16 in that time. Gave up in the end. Have tried again this morning at 8:30 on the dot, started as position 3, an hour later and I've been stuck at position 1 for the last 45 mins. What has someone got to do to get an appointment to speak with their doctor because you ringing them sure doesn't seem to be the answer!

author: Irrelevant to discussion
title: Trying to get GP appointment
body:
I have been having slight chest discomfort/pain. I wanted to see my gp .. actually any gp. Unfortunately i have to go through the secretary before that's a possibility. Why should i have to disclose my personal medical information to someone that is not a trained medical professional? I am unsure that non-medical staff will be able to triage patients effectively. Being that this person may also be someone that is familiar with people in your local area, what safeguards are in place that my information is being kept private?  
I was told that no appointments were available. That the system doesn't book far enough ahead so i need to phone back in a weeks time for an appointment that presumably wont be for another 4 weeks. This is actual insanity. I was then advised to phone an ambulance. My discomfort is not serious enough to waste the time of ambulance staff who i can only imagine would be utterly perplexed why they are attending a call like this. In my opinion this system of using reception staff to gatekeep speaking to your doctor is completely unfit for purpose. There is no space for nuance, either you're at immediate risk and must phone an ambulance, or you're not and can therefore apparently wait 4-6 weeks for a phone call from your GP.

title: Rebook and go elsewhere
body:
Just been for the first time to Alderwood for my COVID booster, I would strongly recommend somebody from this practice visits other centres to see how they are organising the COVID booster programme.
  I stood outside for nearly an hour in near freezing temperatures with every body else who believed they had booked an appointment.
  Grossly understaffed for the volume of people and sadly very poor flow of the actual process, only one poor chap dealing with the non existent parking.
  With hindsight I should have rebooked and gone to Great Worley.

title: Very good department
body: Having had to return to the walk in centre area of Chorley Hospital within days of my last visit ,due to a Change in my condition. Seeing a different doctor he was as consistantly  helpful and cheerful as the first doctor. All staff were actively helping incoming patients, this department seems to be very organised and flows well. I personally like the well applied system at the entrance and desk area,keeping all safe as possible. Well done  ,and thank you  for being there for us All. Which proves how much we need Chorley Hospital..

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor
body: After been referred to parkside middlesbrough everything was great my coordinator was really good at making things calm and he listened to me even though it is very hard for me to express my feelings things were good until the cannot make it this week then even longer now they won't even call back after been told they would I find it very hard to express how I am feeling and to be pushed aside as it that's it you got your meds even though I have not had any checkups to see how they work I've had blood tests and ecg but once again no report  I feel as if I'm been  just left alone and forgotten I ferl like just throwing my meds away and let things take there corse iv had enough of been pushed aside all my life iv been waiting for a asd assessment for about 14 months and that don't help sorry but I feel my emotions are on overload

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students
Tees, Esk and Wear Valleys NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent GP surgery
body:
I’ve been with this surgery since 2016. They have always been friendly, accommodating and provided a great service. One of these services included diagnosing a condition that an Out of Hours GP and A&E missed which without exaggeration saved her life.  While they are busy if you complete an eConsult during normal surgery hours you do get a call to discuss your issue.
While they are mostly phone calls at the moment (understandably) they do still do face to face appointments if necessary. 
Doctors are caring, the nurses are friendly and my experiences with the receptionists are very positive.
I would recommend this surgery to everyone.

title: Very uncomfortable experience
body:
I have an underlying medical condition that means I’m more at risk of Covid complications. I booked my booster after being told to multiple times by my GP and NHS reminders, only to face what felt like an interrogation by the volunteers running the service. I’m under 40, and was met with disbelief at the idea that I have a medical condition, and faced questioning at every stage of the process, including multiple times by the person administering my jab.
I understand it’s important to make sure that procedures are being followed, but a touch of compassion would be nice.
Also, volunteer on the door was not very covid secure, constantly touching my arm when talking to me.
Would not recommend getting your jab here if you can avoid it.

title: Improvement Needed
body: More doctors and administration staff are needed and e consultations need to be answered within the time frame provided. You are sometimes waiting over 4 days to hear back about an e consultation you have submitted!

title: Rude, unhelpful reception staff
body:
My husband has ongoing issues with his eye. But in recent weeks it’s been really worrying him resulting in blurred to no vision in his left eye. He couldn’t get an appointment at a convenient time ( he works in London ) and had to see a private GP who prescribed antibiotics a d steroids . 
After 4 weeks there was not much improvement so he tried once again to get a book on the day appointment only to be told there are none available. Or phone the next day and his condition wasn’t considered as an urgent request . 
Once again he had to find help from an alternative source. 
I get that drs are under pressure I work in a similar environment and will go out of my way to book a patient in and have no right to decide what is or isn’t urgent . 
Clearly this is why A&E have up to 8 hrs waiting time ! People can’t get appointments with their GP’s so over burdening their hospitals with minor issues that previously we trusted our GP’s with .

author: Impressedmilan
title: Compassionate, supportive and encouraging care
body:
I am writing this on behalf of both my mum and myself (as her carer).  
A huge thank you to the community stroke team who cover Gedling in Nottinghamshire.  
Following 2 strokes my mum was discharged from hospital in September 2021 after a 2 month admission. We were contacted within days of discharge by the stroke team and the next week my mum was working on her recovery goals at home with the Occupational Therapist, the Physiotherapist and the Speech & Language Therapist.  
Under their compassionate, supportive and encouraging care my mum has thrived; she’s reached and exceeded her goals. For 8 weeks she’s been visited weekly by a member of each discipline. The input into my mum’s care and recovery has been incredible and she has benefited greatly, as have I.  
As main carer for my mum I’ve felt included and supported too and appreciated the advice and guidance provided to me.  
My mum wants to add a few words of her own too, “Thank you very much. It was nice to have you. You’ve been so kind and helpful, you’ve helped me so much. I’m so thankful to you and with Christmas coming I wish you a very Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year”.  
Thea, Isla and Kirsten and everyone else involved with my mum’s care – we can’t thank you enough. You’ve all been amazing and have made such a positive difference to us both in what could have been a very challenging time. Thank you.

readBy.name: Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

title: The worst
body:
I've tried calling for a few days now for my partner and every time I call it either says "the health centre is closed" even though its open or that the "operators are busy". 
My Dr's has an online service and also answers the calls even if there's no appointments will help you..
The sooner he moves Dr's the better. 
What if he needed heart medication or something else as important. Absolute joke...

title: Much needed local access to consultants
body: I was offered an UNHEARD OF (Sunday) GP appointment yesterday to deal with worrying nosebleeds. On Saturday I had an echocardiogram. In recent months I have seen an ENT doctor, had a telephone appointment with a cardiac consultant, and been fitted with a Holter Monitor. All these in an unpressured, local environment. I can walk there but parking is easy and (currently) free of charge. What’s not to like?

author: Gina+ NewYork1954
title: Attending A&E after being in a serious car accident
body:
In November, coming home from a quick break at our caravan, a car went into the back of our car,causing it to roll and land on the opposite side of the road. My husband stayed static in his seat, but I was thrown out of the passenger seat with my legs being locked in my seat by the seat belt, and my body behind my husband seat.  
As you can imagine this was terrifying and with help of the general public and the emergency services excellent response my husband was able to walk out of the car but I had to be cut out. This took time and was done professionally with great care,  
I was then taken to Kings Mill Hospital A&E which was under a great deal of stress due to being extremely busy. There were beds with people in every space availability,I ended up next to the sink where staff had to wash their hands. I cannot express how stressful this situation affected me as I was in a head brace and flat on my back and could only hear chaos. I went into total shock and due to the amount of people coming into the A&E and the lack of staff I was left alone with very few people acknowledging my existence or my pain. I received all the correct tests (I think) but no real care, understanding and advice of what to expect after such a bad accident.  
I understand that I was lucky because I had no broken bones or cuts, but I can assure you my body was shook and banged all over the inside of the car leaving me badly bruised inside and out. What I want to really say is that being in A&E that day was as traumatic as the accident and left me feeling stressed and full of anxiety. I cannot blame the staff but the system which fails these people to be able to deliver a professional and fully caring health service. I also think that they were having to deal with situations that GPs should be handling.  
I hope this helps you understand how individuals really feel when they have faced something that will affect them for the rest of the lives.

title: Never answers phone
body: You’ll see that they have blamed the telephone company since 2020 for why they don’t answer their phones. Welp…. It’s over a year later and same issues. Tried phoning 30+ times to get an urgent dressing change appointment sorted. Busy busy busy….. rings and disconnects. I feel horrible for the staff because obviously they need more help but, these little GP issues can easily develop into more difficult ones!

title: Disgusted with staff regarding my Autistic Son
body: I visited the nightingale hospital at Washington for my son who has Autism to have he’s booster. He is exempt from wearing a face mask due to he’s disability, the staff were very uncooperative and not very understanding of he’s situation which left him very distressed. This needs to be sorted for other people coming to the Hospital

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

title: Excellent practice
body: Over the last 20 months I have been treated and helped amazingly. Under such difficult circumstances I can only praise the whole team, my Diabetes nurse and others have been so helpful. Only down fall is the telephone system but with so many patient's it is going to be difficult getting through. Thank you for all your help , care and attention.

title: Straight forward
body:
Really easy to book the covid boosters and ran very smooth on arrival.
Sign posting and staff were very friendly and made me feel welcomed

author: Mrs Green
title: Difficulty in booking appointments
body:
I work Monday to Friday as a health care professional and I needed an appointment to see my GP . However, I was informed I couldn’t make an appointment that I would have to phone between 8:30am and 10:30am and be triaged. My condition was non urgent and I felt someone who was in much more need to speak with a doctor probably needs a phone consultation much more.  
I tried calling at 8:30am but the phone was continually engaged. I was working and felt constantly stressed trying to get through. Eventually a GP phoned an hour later. However, I was at work in front of other colleagues and had to go into a room for privacy which is often disturbed with others needing the room.  
Why as a healthcare worker do we now feel stressed trying to make an appointment , and can no longer get an appointment which suits round working hours? I realise GP’s are under a tremendous workload and appreciate everything they do . But this has now become so frustrating trying to get an appointment that has often led to me just giving up being seen.

title: Quick and competent
body: I'm glad that it was a nurse who knew how to aspirate the needle when giving the booster jab. Got it intramuscularly and no other symptoms than the expected heaviness of arm. Quick job and no fainting.

title: Great hard working caring staff
body: Excellent caring professional staff on ward C4 i was here for 6 days with no visitors allowed i was so scared after my long 9 hour operation,the staff treated me like they was my family thank you so much each and everyone of you.

title: Amazingly kind and very efficient.
body: The wonderful ambulance service brought me to A&E early yesterday morning.  From the moment that I was collected from my home, I was assured that I was in safe hands.  I was in considerable pain and I gave myself up to their care.  The doctor, the x-ray department staff, the physio therapist and the ambulance crew deserve mention for their professionalism and their absolute kindness.  Truly, I am indebted to them all.  Thank you very, very much,

title: Very poor service
body: When I called the earliest available appointment to see a GP about being referred to a specialist for a known condition was in three weeks. When the day arrived, the appointment lasted 5 minutes where the GP told me I should wait for a text message shortly to refer myself to the relevant service however this text message never arrived. I followed up via email with the practice and had no response. Overall it's been over a month so far and I'm still waiting.

title: Great teamwork
body: I recently had great care from the whole team at the practice when I needed an urgent referral to hospital, resulting in an operation leaving me with a wound that the nursing team dressed every day for 3 weeks. I’m very grateful for their reliable care and kindness which I’m sure helped me to heal quickly. I do agree with other comments that it’s difficult to get through on the phone – but I always find the reception staff to be very polite and helpful.

title: Fantastic service.
body: I can not recommend this service highly enough I have called on several 4 and they are so skilled ,understanding and very caring .This service is invaluable and i could not have managed without it. This is vital for people at a time they need the support and advice that is there when you need it .Please never close you are fantastic. A very big Thankyou for being there and the vital service you provide.

author: Jock ra Jiner
title: Good progress following a broken humerus
body:
I broke my Humerus after a trip at the back door in April. Thankfully our Granddaughter was in the house at the time & was able to muster Ambulance assistance as I could not move. This accident resulted in my wife being relocated to Jean Mackie Centrea as she had dementia, Her move was the last time she was at home as she died in Bandrum Nursing home in July, pausing our 65 year unconditional love affair.  
After examination a sling was placed and I then had to exercise gradually to start with till now where my shoulder is much better & 90% mobility restored. I would register my appreciation of the overall service provided by Victoria Hospital fracture unit, associated nursing care & now visits to Whitefield Day Hospital in Queen Margaret Hospital where my wife nursed many years ago. They have been very good with no complaints on overall services provided.  
That accident has made me much more careful as it happened due to me catching my foot on the underside of the threshold timber at back door. The Physiotherapist @ Whitefield (Eilidh) is very good explaining my exercises as we go along. The overall result from my fall has been a diagnosis of Osteoperosis and I now have tablets to assist in keeping my bones stronger. Well done Fife Care partnership for all your help over the last years not only with me but also with my wife through Fife Council start team & Integrity care personnel who were excellent. My God I miss her terribly.

title: 12+hours no call back
body: Filled form out online for 13 year old child, with high temperature, sore throat and generally unwell. Was in formed I would get a call back within 2 hours still waiting 12 hours +. Its no wonder A&E is over run with people that just need to see a GP not a consultant in emergency practice.

title: Terrible Response times
body: As I wrote this review I’ve just entered hour 7 sat in the A&E dept with a possible fractured foot. As I look around I see that they have a display labelled ‘Where quality matters’ with one of those heading under that being ‘Responsive’. I’m normally a massive fan of the NHS and know that with coronavirus it’s not easy, however, the service I am currently received is exceptionally poor. Following quickly going through X-ray I thought it would be a relatively quick appointment with doctor, needing nothing more than a yes or a no that it was fractured. 5 hours after these X-rays I’m still waiting. I’ve seen person after person who has arrived after me go through to the doctor, whereas I’m still sat waiting. Poor, very poor.

title: My stay at Beech Ward
body: I was recently admitted via A&E to Beech Ward. I would like to thank all the staff who worked in the ward, including the cleaners, dinner people, nurses and doctors. They were all extremely efficient, professional, approachable with excellent peoples’ skills. The ward was kept spotless and the staff were always on hand to assist, even though they are working in difficult circumstances. The staff in Beech ward are a credit to the hospital and thank you very much in helping me having a speedy recovery.

author: rainrs68
title: Recycling
body:
I recently spent some time in RHC with my infant son. From the time I arrived, I was alarmed by the lack of recycling going on in the hospital. I understand that clinical waste must be treated separately, however it was a real cause for concern that my meals were served on polystyrene plates, hot drinks and soup in polystyrene cups and that even when I was given plastic cups for water and my sandwich came in a plastic box, there wasn’t a recycling bin in the room. So it had to go in the general waste. The most astonishing thing was actually that the bottles, used to warm and feed expressed breast milk from or provide formula in, were thrown away. Not sterilised and reused. That’s not the teats, the actual bottles.  
Not only must these practices be a colossal waste of money, but they are extremely harmful to the environment. We’ve just hosted COP26. Why is this still happening? In my opinion we need to do better.

title: Stay away
body: Do not use this hospital.  My child was extremely sick and I write this review whilst still waiting for her to be assessed.  8 1/2 and counting still not been seen. I could have driven her to Scotland quicker. Avoid avoid avoid travel elsewhere !!!!

title: Unprofessional
body: I visited the surgery the afternoon of 3rd December, the receptionist I spoke to was very helpful and polite. Unfortunately the noise level from the office at the back of reception was horrendous, myself and the receptionist had difficulty hearing what each other were saying. Thankfully the receptionist closed the door which made a massive difference. I feel sorry for the patients who were waiting to see a doctor. It made the surgery look very unprofessional.

title: Efficient and caring
body: I was in severe pain when I entered the hospital a security guard saw my distress and offered me a wheelchair to A&E.  I was processed relatively quickly through to getting pain meds.  While waiting for the cannula to be put in, I again was in obvious distress and everyone who passed me waiting asked whether I was being seen to.  It is reassuring that despite everyone being busy that the basics for patient care and reassurance are also happening.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Excellent practice
body: I feel very lucky to live in the catchment of the Bounds Green Group Practice. The medical staff cover a lot of specialisms between them, which is one of the benefits of a large and well-organised group practice like this. Doctors and nursing staff have treated my family with great care and attention over the years, with some doctors going above and beyond - to my eternal gratitude. I find the E-consult system very useful and hope that this will continue. Deeply impressive response to COVID vaccination delivery.

author: airwx98
title: Dealing with a heroin problem
body:
I used to be an addict from 1994 to 2005 when I got clean, started a new life, a new job and got married had kids, but I got made redundant in March 2020 and given a lot of redundancy money, because of covid I couldn’t do my plan of visiting places etc, I wasn’t even allowed to visit my ex wife and kids because of lockdown and the fact I share a house with others who are not related, in my boredom I made the stupid choice to buy heroin from someone who I started to notice passing my house, this quickly turned into an addiction and after 3 months I decided enough was enough.  
After a few phone consultations with S2S I was quickly prescribed medication which I stuck to rigidly because I did not want to lose my life again, because of lockdown face to face visits were not possible but I had regular phone calls from my support worker and the doctor to see how I was coping, this regular contact albeit by phone was very helpful and reinforced my desire to stick with the program, I eventually found a new job after just 5 months out of work, the continued support from S2S was fantastic and I was finally clean and off all medication after 1 year, I am still in my job and still clean :-)

title: A Series of Upsetting Experiences
body:
Both my partner & I have ADHD, alongside my partner's challenging Axial Spondyloarthritis. These conditions require repeat medications & sensitive ongoing care.

The issues we have faced over the past four years are myriad. Refusals to prescribe ADHD medication, with no reasons given, despite it being the NHS' recommended first-line treatment; sudden & unexplained rejections of repeat prescriptions that have been in place for years, discovered only when our medication has run out; a consistent pattern of promising contact from one staff member or another, then no contact occurring; communication systems that make it almost impossible for my partner, who is a school teacher, to speak to a human being (even in written form) at the practice.

We are lifelong passionate supporters & advocates of the NHS, and know the pressure that the system is under. But these issues significantly predate the pandemic, and is genuinely not an exaggeration to say that our experiences with the practice have negatively impacted our lives on multiple occasions.

It's almost amusing that, upon finally losing my patience, I found my way to a page with two links: one to leave feedback for a good experience & for a bad experience...

The bad experience link takes you to a "page not found" error.

title: Another great experience
body:
This is my second cataract surgery at Spamedica Eccleshill in 2021, had the last one in August and l have to tell you both of my visits were brilliant.  Very efficient and thorough, Howard the porter looked after me from start to finish, reassuring me and putting me at ease the whole time.  Would not hesitate to recommend them to anyone.
David Robinson

title: Vaccination
body: Just taken my Father for his booster at Jameson House after so efficiently booked on telephone    Wow. Such an efficient and polite experience. Well done all concerned. Thank you for your great work.  It is appreciated

title: Fantastic informative Careful Service
body:
I had two sessions with the DMP on the 2nd.
The first was to have a hearing assessment at the DCH for the fitting of a new hearing aid. The audiologist that saw me was incredibly helpful and I even received a copy of her review to my doctor over the weekend just gone. The amount of information of what can be done to help me was amazing. Fantastic service throughout.
My second visit was to The South Street clinic where I had a wart burnt out. Incredibly kind, honest and gentle treatment throughout. Again, fantastic service throughout.

author: LisaP
title: Wonderful Physiotherapist
body:
Claire has been wonderful in taking me on to treat me. I have cording in my veins on my left arm due to damage from my first chemotherapy infusion.  
When I first met Claire I was very anxious that my arm was going to be left in a state that is both painful and had very little movement.  
Claire immediately put my mind at rest that she was going to do everything to try and help me even though this was not an issue that her of the team had had experience of treating . To have her commitment and support at this time has helped me so so much.  
Each week Claire has continued to try every technique to fix my arm. She has enabled my arm to move a significant amount which has been very comforting to me, helping me in my road to recovery.  
I look forward to my sessions as she is just a wonderful, lovely upbeat girl and always great to talk too.  
Thank you so so much for all your help. Xx

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Not picking phone calls
body: Rang at 8 am bang on and said am 7th in queue position,  after 10 minutes they cutted my phone call, I rang back 100 times , no one answered my phone then I had to go personal to book appointment,  very disappointed.  Never picks phone calls in morning.

title: Wonderful
body: My teenager fell ill on M1 and your A&E was nearby.  From the moment we entered we were looked after by your lovely staff.  They were unfailingly pleasant and listened.  Despite seeming very full, I our waiting times weren’t too long and the doctor we saw after tests, explained all clearly and offered strategies for improving the situation.  We felt better for just being treated as human beings.  Also the waiting areas were bright and cheerful.  Thank you all.

readBy.name: Chesterfield Royal Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Unprofessional insulting and demeaning
body: I received a message asking me to book myself in for a health check. I am 60. I have thyroid problems and diabetes running in my family. I was told to weigh myself on some scales followed by laughs. I remained silent and I could not believe how crude or insulting this reception was. My stunned silence ensured my determination not to be dismissed.

title: Booster jab
body: I found the staff to be very efficient welcoming and my visit was stress free the professional approach from all concerned to ensure the most safe environment was perfect

title: unfriendly staff
body: Spoked on phone to one of their staff, he already sounds not friendly to me and during the call he just hang up. I had to wait 1 1/2 for someone answering my call and hanging up just like that is very rude.

title: The worst doctors possible
body:
Rang more than 20 times then put in a que for 1 hour 6 minutes then to be disconnected when I am 2 in the que. I’ve had to come out ov work to go in and get an emergency appointment for my daughter, The receptionist said ‘well we do have 13,00 patients to get through’ 😡 That does NOT mean it’s ok to cancel my call after waiting in a que 😡
I tried to get an appointment all week last week as well. I rang every day at 8am sharp and still couldn’t get her in. Shocking service and even worst customer service off the receptionist.

author: CatFace
title: Supportive Brain Injury Rehabilitation
body:
I suffered a Subarachnoid Brain Haemorrhage in January of 2020 while on holiday in Belfast, NI. I spent just over 2 weeks in hospital there and then was discharged home to Glasgow, where I was referred to the Community Treatment Centre for Brain Injury. My main issues were struggling to cope with fatigue and anxiety.  
For just over a year, I had weekly to fortnightly sessions with an occupational therapist and then a clinical psychologist, both of whom were so useful and helpful in my recovery. I was able to talk about my feelings surrounding my recovery and get practical, actionable advice on how to improve my work-life and my mental health. Having that regular support, and space to discuss my feelings, with someone who understood what I was going through was fundamental to my recovery.I have recently been discharged from the service with the understanding that I can contact them again at any time should I need any further help and support. I am so grateful to them and the service they provide.

author: Larjag33
title: Informed me of what they were doing at each step
body: This week I had two radiotherapy sessions and a planning session, having previously had a very mixed experience of care and errors during my cancer journey. The interaction and care from the radiotherapy department has been very positive, all staff I encountered about 8 in total were very empathetic, kind, clear and professional informing me what they were doing at each step. Thank you

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Tia B
title: My journey from start till where I'm at up to presently
body: About 3 maybe a little longer I was referred to the gender clinic by my gp I was then put on a waiting list which took longer than I'd have liked but with the pandemic and everything I could understand it would cause more delay but hung in there I had a few moments were I couldn't cope an had to ask for some support off my care workers I had and they got me through it my first appointment was by video wich was long but was OK and soon after I got my second appointment wich then I had to stop smoking wich delayed any hormones so had 3 months to quit before I seen him again I referred myself to a stop smoking service an succeed at quitting I've now had hormones 3 an a quarter months and doing speach therapy which the tutor is lovely to do the voice therapy with I had a review on my hormones and up to yet all the staff have been lovely and amazing

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Worse Practice
body: This is the Worse surgery in this Area, We moved in this area 5 months ago, we tried couple of time but it is impossible to connect the call, staff are very rude, instead helping they try to ignore you by asking you to do this do that and avoid to give appointment, Today I started calling them at 07:59 and made totally 264 calls without any break, then I got connect at 8:58 and came to know all appointment are already finished and receptionist giving lecture, have you done Covid test, when I told her I already done yesterday at home and it is negative, then she said oh no, you have to test center and do it. I explain her I have bad tonsils history and due to dust allergy my tonsils get swelled and start pain in my throat and make difficult to talk, also explain I have used all cold and flu capsules available on the counter but it did not work because at the last resort Doctor always give me Antibiotics so I just need doctor to look my history and issue me the Antibiotic and i will collect them from the Pharmacy but she was just trying to ignore me. I don`t know why we are wasting our taxes on these surgeries, it is better instead paying them we need to have health insurance and pay them. I will never go there again and not advise anyone to go there to waste their time.

author: LBAYR
title: My heartfelt thanks
body: I would like to express my heartfelt thanks to the staff in Station 12 at Ayr Hospital, as well as the CAU (yellow zone) and A&E, for the care, dignity and respect that they showed my mum during her stay in these departments. My mum recently received palliative care and every single member of staff was kind, compassionate and thoughtful towards both my mum and the members of my family who visited during this difficult time. It was very much appreciated x

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: shatzer
title: Dedicated Community Respiratory Team
body:
I want to extend my sincere thanks to Michaela, Frances & Patrocia for your efforts during the time of my illness. It was really a tough time for me but what you did for me is undoubtedly appreciated. You helped to recovery faster. I lost some hope but luckily you proved me wrong and we can not tell you how much comfort you have given to me.  
I don’t have enough words to show you the gratitude. You are the best nurses I have ever seen in my life. You were always there for me whenever I needed you, either it was hospital or home. I make sure that I will always recommend you as a nurse if anybody is in need.  
I am very grateful to you for all your care and support. You have done so much for me. You have shown a lot of effort for my health care. You have really helped me a lot.  
Thank you so much to Michaela (Community Respiratory Team) and Patrocia (Rehab Team), you have done a lot for me. I have made a faster recovery because of your efforts. Your rehab sessions also helped me a lot in recovery.  
Nurses like you can help anybody recover. I am so impressed with your dedication.  
Thank you once again!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Hayey47
title: My Daughter getting an ambulance and the crew were absolutely outstanding
body: My daughter had to be given her rescue meds due to epilepsy seizures, 999 was called..we live quite down the peninsula, it took them just 30 mins to get to us which was brilliant..my Daughter has complex needs and Hospital has always been very challenging for her.. when she came round in ambulance Patrick was absolutely amazing..telling her wee stories and showing her pictures of his pets & this meant so so much to her and made it a very positive & good experience and he give her a bar of chocolate (her favourite) to keep when she gets to hospital to see the Doctors..and a wee crystal to always keep her safe, it touched us so so much! She talks about him every day & stated next time she wants them 2 to come to take us to Hospital..absolutely amazing they deserve recognition as I am forever greatful how it all went smoothly!

readBy.name: Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: whisperek63
title: Great service
body: I really struggled to get an appointment as the phone line was constantly engaged. I was on hold for 45 minutes one day but as soon as I spoke to the staff I was sorted very efficiently and had lovely service, from the triage, seeing the nurse and Dr to being sent with contraception and ongoing service.

author: starhg85
title: Didn’t check my scans before surgery
body: I had a serious fall in which I had broken every single bone from my belly button downward resulting in complete loss of sensation in my pelvic area so I required a long term catheter so a supra pubic was supposed by my GP and I was scheduled for a day procedure at St Albans city hospital. I came for my surgery I got dressed in a gown and then five minutes before I was due to be operated on the surgeon came in and said he’d just looked at my scans and despite telling them I had over 25 metal plates screwed to my lower body he hadn’t checked if this surgery was even possible

author: 69 year old woman
title: Hysteroscopy agony
body:
I had a hysteroscopy a number of years ago - absolute agony! I requested a smaller speculum - the doctor just said commented that I'd had a baby, so what's the problem, and didn't stop. The attending nurse was virtually holding me down.  
I now have to have another one but I've demanded a General Anaesthetic - my body, my choice. The consultant said she could do it now but I refused. They tried to dissuade me from a GA as I have COPD but I persisted so they reluctantly filled out the paperwork and am now waiting for an out-patient day surgery appointment. Will see how it goes.

author: Waterbaby16
title: Still awaiting treatment
body: I went in to get treatment for my warts and did a swab which came back saying I’ve got chlamydia I’ve waited over a week from finding out to received treatment and I have been told a number of times I will be able to get it from the clinic but every time I go in there isn’t a doctor available to give me a prescription so I contacted my own GP but they need proof of my result to be able to issue me with a prescription. I rang the clinic asking for this to be sent over but they have failed to do this or even tell me a date of when I can receive the treatment

author: D shore
title: I felt reassured
body: I felt very warmly received. I was listened to and the staff reassured and advised me appropriately. It was a lovely friendly experience. The staff were absolutely outstanding. Thank you.

author: Bri44
title: Fabulous service
body:
I had an Orthopaedic appointment at Castlehill to see my Consultant who I am under for severe arthritis. Whilst their I informed my Consultant of the severe pain I was experiencing with a lump which had developed on my Section. Due to the severity of what he saw, he requested me to go to Hull Royal infirmary, as it needed addressing immediately.  
When I arrived at A&E, I was treated with care by the nurses & GPS,  
The surgeon from ward 6 ( Fathima ) made me feel at ease, talked to me about my medical history with care & passion, whilst doing the surgical procedure. Jackie coordinator nurse attended to support myself and Fathima and talked to me all the way through. I very grateful, to them both. Sorry to Jackie if I squeezed her hand to tightly !!!  
Please pass on my thanks

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

author: phasezw63
title: Care given to me
body:
I fell down my stairs in May 21 & broke my ankle in 3 places. I needed a 5 hour operation to insert 3 metal plates and 9 pins. Following my operation there were several complications. I needed follow up care from the Rehab team, Triage, District Nursing, Phlebotomy, & Physio. I want to praise all the staff involved but names that stand out are Bercy from Triage, Busola from BRS, Lisa from Phlebotomy, Hayley & Debra from Pha, to name just a few.  
Everyone has been so kind, and Debra has patiently helped me to gain relative confidence and set realistic goals in terms of managing obstacles to my mobility.  
I also want to thank my Line Manager and others who have been in regular touch with me which has helped with the mental trauma that has followed the accident.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: BluelabelD
title: Amazing Day Surgery
body: I came in to Wishaw General to Day Surgery to receive treatment for an infected cut to my finger which had gone septic. The staff were amazing and took care off me before and after my operation. Gwen and the team are a credit to the NHS and I went home happy for my dinner.

author: Susan1965
title: Care received in 7c RVH
body: My daughter who has special needs was admitted to 7c. It was obviously a very anxious time for her and the family. The staff allowed me as her mum to stay with her throughout the day. They were so kind and compassionate, always checking in on us and offering tea and biscuits. Nothing was too much trouble. The ward appeared to be really busy and staff run off their feet but they always had a kind smile and offered words of comfort. Special thanks to the sister and deputy sister who appeared to manage the ward very well, and had time to sit and chat. It's the small things that make a difference.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Janet61
title: My first ever hospital stay
body: Having never ever been in a hospital in my 60 years, I was absolutely petrified going in. Everyone from the Post Menopausal Bleeding Clinic with a special mention for Sister Sheila to The Surgeon, Dr Allum at University Hospital, Wishaw, the Anaesthetist. Tomas, the theatre staff, Nadia, Rachel, Amanda, Elspeth, I remember all the names and the empathy shown when I was admitted for my op. They put me at ease and literally held my hand every step of the way. I was still laughing with Tomas when he was preparing to anaesthesise me but I was totally unaware of this and was in the middle of joking with him and boom I was asleep. The recovery staff were amazing, the ward staff in ward 13, Isavel, Sonia, Rachel, Jazz, Vicky, Andrea,.... Too many to mention. The way I was treated, you'd never know the NHS was struggling. These girls are working long hours and their only thought is for their patients. Every single one of them are angels. Even the cleaner and the meals staff were so lovely. Please recognise these people. To me it's them that represent the NHS and its them I will be flying the flag for. Their reassurance is commendable. Thank you will never, EVER cover it.
